channel.title: Trusted content on Docker Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Trusted content on Docker Docs

item.title: Docker Verified Publisher Program
item.description: The Docker Verified Publisher Program provides high-quality images from commercial publishers verified by Docker. These images help development teams build secure software supply chains, minimizing exposure to malicious content early in the process to save time and money later. Images that are part of this program have a special badge on Docker Hub making it easier for users to identify projects that Docker has verified as high-quality commercial publishers.

item.title: Docker-Sponsored Open Source Program
item.description: Docker Sponsored Open Source images are published and maintained by open-source projects sponsored by Docker through the program. Images that are part of this program have a special badge on Docker Hub making it easier for users to identify projects that Docker has verified as trusted, secure, and active open-source projects. For content publishers The Docker-Sponsored Open Source (DSOS) Program provides several features and benefits to non-commercial open source developers.

item.title: Insights and analytics
item.description: Insights and analytics provides usage analytics for Docker Verified Publisher (DVP) and Docker-Sponsored Open Source (DSOS) images on Docker Hub. This includes self-serve access to image and extension usage metrics for a desired time span. You can also display the number of image pulls by tag or by digest, and get breakdowns by geolocation, cloud provider, client, and more. Tip Head to the Docker Verified Publisher Program or Docker-Sponsored Open Source pages to learn more about the programs.
